qas.question: The National Symphony Orchestra is led by what gender of violinist?
The double bass, brass and percussion sections are predominately what gender?
What type of audition are expected to eliminator gender or racial prejudice?
In what section of the New York Philharmonic do women outnumber men?

context: In 2013, an article in Mother Jones stated that while "[m]any prestigious orchestras have significant <a0_0>female<a0_0/> membership—women outnumber men in the New York Philharmonic's <a3_0>violin<a3_0/> section—and several renowned ensembles, including the National Symphony Orchestra, the Detroit Symphony, and the Minnesota Symphony, are led by women violinists", the double bass, brass, and percussion sections of major orchestras "...are still predominantly <a1_0>male<a1_0/>." A 2014 BBC article stated that the "...introduction of <a2_0>'blind' auditions<a2_0/>, where a prospective instrumentalist performs behind a screen so that the judging panel can exercise no gender or racial prejudice, has seen the gender balance of traditionally male-dominated symphony orchestras gradually shift."
